meanings.definition: A spinning move or maneuver, especially in sports or dance.
meanings.sent1: During the figure skating competition, she executed a flawless spinarama.
meanings.sent2: The hockey player amazed the crowd with a perfect spinarama to score a goal.
meanings.sent3: The clown's spinarama on the stage made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her spinarama on the dance floor was like a graceful whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The spinning top's spinarama was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: To perform a spinarama move or maneuver.
meanings.sent1: He decided to spinarama his way out of the tricky situation.
meanings.sent2: She always loves to spinarama when she dances salsa.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to spinarama quickly to catch the falling plate.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to spinarama across the open field.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's spinarama added flair to her routine.

meanings.definition: The act of spinning or rotating rapidly.
meanings.sent1: The dizzying spinarama of the carousel delighted the children.
meanings.sent2: The sudden spinarama of the tornado caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected spinarama of events left him bewildered.
meanings.sent4: The whirlwind's spinarama scattered leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The helicopter's spinarama was both thrilling and terrifying.
